Before you lies an ornately designed sarcophagus carved from one single chunk of adra so pure it's nearly translucent.

The silhouette of whoever lies within is clear, but the details of their features are obscured.

You find an opaque panel on the side of the sarcophagus engraved with cryptic symbols.

Within this panel is a hole that reaches into the depths of the sarcophagus, ringed by a polished metal pointer.

Around this central piece are three stone plaques, each with an image carved in relief - a bird, an angler fish, and two eels devouring one another.
[Inspect the plaques and pointer.]
[Try to move the pointer.]
The moment you begin to turn the pointer, a grating rumble reverberates through the chamber and the ground beneath you shakes.
An ancient groan shudders through the platform beneath you as mechanisms long neglected begin to move.
[Leave.]
Not particularly keen to risk whatever trick is no doubt in store, you back away from sarcophagus.
[Reach into the hole.]
You reach into the hole and feel something rough and dry at your fingertips. You pull it out to reveal arm bones and the remnants of a hand.
Your curiosity unsated, you reach back into the hole and find a handle within the belly of the sarcophagus. You push and pull at it to no effect, but turning it does appear to show some promise.
[Twist the handle.]
The handle twists around, then stops and releases a soft click. Nothing happens that you can see.
The handle grinds as you turn it, then stops, releasing a soft click. The door behind you slides open with a woosh. Sand stops pouring from the nearby statues.
[SkillCheck 0] nudges the skeleton on the floor and grimaces.
The handle appears to be a dead man's switch - it stops the trap, but only so long as the handle itself is held.
[Release the handle.]

The plaques have been carved with exquisite care. You recognize the depicted creatures as the Huana images of the gods Amira, Ngati, and Rikuhu. The pointer currently rests between the images of Amira and Ngati.
You run your fingers along the edge of the pointer's track, searching for details your eyes may have missed. You feel a barely perceptible notch at the center of Rikuhu's plaque.
Based on the presence of the pointer and the carved plaques, you deduce that the sarcophagus is sealed by a combination lock.
[Attempt to open the sarcophagus with force.]
You wedge your fingers into a good handhold, gather your strength, and try to heave the lid open. It won't budge.
[Puzzle begins]
[Examine the sarcophagus further.]
An adra sarcophagus is no match for you. You find a good handhold, gather your strength, and heave open the lid of the sarcophagus.

Although the lid of the sarcophagus appears fragile, it's impervious to your attempts to shatter it.

You wedge two prybars beneath the lip of the sarcophagus' lid. One snaps when you put pressure on it, but the other bites deep into the adra, and you're able to muscle the lid open.

The sarcophagus is revealed to contain the long-dead remains of an ancient corpse, dressed head to feet in the colorful regalia of a Huana chieftain.

The body lies on a sheet of adra, behind which you can see the interlocking gears and ancient machinery of the sarcophagus' lock.
The skeleton is surrounded by a king's ransom's worth of old coins and precious gems. Held within the skeleton's hands is a well-worn, many-layered cloth festooned with pockets.
[Take the burial goods.]
[Take the cloth.]
[Try to move the pointer.]
Based on your earlier inspection of the plaques, you're fairly certain that the Rikuhu plaque is the first in the sequence.
[The bird, Amira.]
You consider where you should place the pointer first.
[The angler fish, Ngati.]
[The eels, Rikuhu.]

You turn the pointer until it clicks into place.

You consider where you should place the pointer next.
For a fourth and final time, you align the pointer with a plaque. You hold your breath.
[The bird, Amira.]
[The angler fish, Ngati.]
[The eels, Rikuhu.]

The sarcophagus rumbles. Something prevents the gears inside from moving.

The mouths of the statues behind you open wider, now set in a silent scream. The sand pours out twice as quickly as before.

The pointer resets to a neutral position.

The sand pouring from the statues slows to a trickle, then stops entirely. The sand already piled on the floor drains from the chamber through a series of grates.

The door behind you slides open.
[Step back from the puzzle.]
You take a step back from the sarcophagus for a moment to settle your nerves.

The ground beneath you shakes. But still, the sarcophagus doesn't open.

More sand pours from the statues' mouths, soon spilling on to the platform itself.

The pointer resets to a neutral position.
The sarcophagus heaves with one final creak. Sand floods the room.
You struggle to free yourself from the rising tide of sand, but it makes no difference. In the space of a moment, you are buried beneath the crushing mass.
As darkness descends, the final image in your mind is of the Pallid Knight's disappointed face.
[Specified 0] lets go of the dead man's switch with a loud sigh of relief.
You hear the low whine of ancient gears refusing to turn. The dead man's switch appears to be preventing the sarcophagus from opening.
You brush grave dust and rotted cloth away from the treasures and pile them into your satchel.
You carefully lift the ancient Huana chieftain's hands away from the cloth and place it in your pack.
The handle seems to be a switch for the room's traps. However, when you release the handle, the sand begins to flow again, and the door behind you creaks shut.
[Specified 0] cries out in surprise. The switch retracts swiftly into the sarcophagus with a high-pitched screech and whine.

You twist the pointer until it clicks into place a second time.

You consider where you should place the pointer next.
[The bird, Amira.]
[The angler fish, Ngati.]
[The eels, Rikuhu.]

You rotate the pointer until it clicks into place a third time.

You consider where you should place the pointer next.
[The bird, Amira.]
[The angler fish, Ngati.]
[The eels, Rikuhu.]
You snatch the cloth from beneath the ancient Huana chieftain's hands as sand pours in around you.
[Return to examining the sarcophagus.]
Sands pours from the statues lining the walls. It piles on the floor, then on the platform. Soon, it is piled at your ankles.
The gears controlling the ancient machinery beneath the sarcophagus squeak and grind after centuries undisturbed.
[Go back.]
[Reach into the hole.]
Through strength and persistence, you manage to dig the sand away from the hole in the sarcophagus and force your arm inside.
You frantically dig sand away from the sarcophagus, trying to get to the hole inside, but it's no use - the sand piles up faster than you can get rid of it.
[Go back.]
"I do hope you wash your hands after this."
"One of these days you'll have to sit me down and explain what you expected to find."
"Bet you're fun at funerals."

"Let us consider not putting our hands into dark holes in a place created to kill us."

Pallegina looks over the hand with morbid curiosity.

"Thanks, cap, I were wondering where I left that."

Serafen's nose wrinkles a your grim prize.
"Next time you leave the digging through holes to Tekēhu, ekera?"
Xoti runs her hand around the rim of the dusty hole. Examining the grave dirt smearing her fingertips, she smiles, then scratches them through her hair.
"If this is a lesson about the value of risk-taking and spontaneity, perhaps we could save it for another time?"
"That thing you just did? Maybe do the opposite."
"Trapped sarcophagus? Who thinks of these things?"

"You had to know that was going to happen."

Pallegina appears unfazed by the suddenly active ancient architecture.
"You know what happens when you be burying your dead at sea? Not this!" His ears twitch as he squats against the rumble.
"Ekera, this happens every time I meddle with the dead!"
"This is why you got to be careful when you're digging up the dead."

[Specified 0]'s face contorts into an expression of panic.

The pointer resets to a neutral position.

[Specified 0] stands and stretches weary muscles, releasing a shaky sigh.

The sand begins to pour from statues again. The pointer resets to a neutral position.
You hold you breath for as long as you can, reaching fruitlessly toward the ever-shrinking gap of air near the ceiling.
You flee from the room, [Specified 4]'s panicked shouts ringing in your ears. A few moments after you've gone, you hear the door slams shut behind you.
You let go of the handle and step away from the sarcophagus.
You hear the grind and rattle of ancient gears turning within the adra sarcophagus. There's a loud pop, then, and the lid of the sarcophagus slides open.
The riches before you are no good to you if you can't get your hands on them, so put your mind to figuring out how to open the sarcophagus.
